During pregnancy, antibiotic selection must prioritize fetal safety. Tetracyclines (B) are contraindicated due to teratogenic risks. Gentamicin (D) is an aminoglycoside with known fetal toxicity. Amoxicillin (C), a penicillin derivative, is considered safe in pregnancy and is the first-line treatment for Lyme disease. Ibuprofen (A) is an NSAID, which is generally avoided in late pregnancy but may be used for symptom management if needed. Since the question asks for the next best step for treatment, the appropriate antibiotic is amoxicillin.
